citeinfo.origin: Florida Fish and Wildlife Conservation Commission (FWC), Fish and Wildlife Research Institute (FWRI), Center for Spatial Analysis
citeinfo.title: Bathymetry of Bahamas and Cuba

descript.abstract: This GIS line data set represents depth contours (bathymetry) for the offshore areas of South Florida, Cuba and the Bahamas, as shown in the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) Nautical Chart 11013 39th Ed., Apr 25/92. FWRI staff digitized the contours off of a clean, wrinkle-free paper chart. This data set also includes the Bahamas shoreline.
descript.purpose: To represent marine depth contours, primarily for small-scale (large area) cartographic purposes.
descript.supplinf: Prior to July 1, 2004, the Fish and Wildlife Research Institute (FWRI) was known as the Florida Marine Research Institute (FMRI). The institute name has not been changed in historical data sets or references to work completed by the Florida Marine Research Institute. The institute name has been changed in references to ongoing research, new research, and contact information. These data are not to be used for navigation. User should be aware that later versions of the source charts may be available and that contours may have changed. Consult the most recent paper or digital charts available and appropriate coast pilot. The only shoreline represented in this data set is that of the Bahamas. (previous geoform was 'vector digital data')

place.placekey: St. Johns River Water Management District

idinfo.accconst: All data must be verified by Principal Investigator or Group Database Analyst prior to release. It is strongly recommended that this data is directly acquired from FWC and not indirectly through other sources which may have changed the data in some way. FWC makes no claims as to the data's suitability for other purposes.
idinfo.useconst: FWC-FWRI and the originator of the data must be credited. This is not a survey data set and should not be utilized as such. These data are not to be used for navigation. Acknowledgement of the FWC-FWRI (Florida Fish and Wildlife Conservation Commission-Fish and Wildlife Research Institute) as the data source would be appreciated in any products developed from these data, and such acknowledgment as is standard for citation and legal practices for data source is expected by users of this data. Please cite the original metadata when using portions of the record to create a similar record of slightly altered data, such as reprojection. If any data are modified or adjusted, please share the edited information with FWC. Users should be aware that comparison with other data sets for the same area from other time periods may be inaccurate due to inconsistencies resulting from changes in mapping conventions, data collection, and computer processes over time. FWC shall not be liable for improper or incorrect use of this data. These data are not legal documents and are not to be used as such. This is not a survey data set and should not be utilized as such. These data are not to be used for navigation.

secinfo.sechandl: Warn user about source map scale. 1: 1.2 million

idinfo.native: Windows NT Version 5.0 (Build 2195) Service Pack 1; ESRI ArcInfo 8.1.0.415

citeinfo.origin: Florida Fish and Wildlife Conservation Commission (FWC), Fish and Wildlife Research Institute (FWRI), Center for Spatial Analysis
citeinfo.title: camra_mrgis_offshore_cubatampabay

attracc.attraccr: Attribute accuracy "Fair". Attribute accuracy determined to be approximately 95%. Test conducted on 5% of randomly selected features, which were compared to source material.

qattracc.attracce: Attribute accuracy "Fair". Attribute accuracy determined to be approximately 95%. Test conducted on 5% of randomly selected features, which were compared to source material.

dataqual.logic: Data are topologically and logically consistent. Used Frequency command in ArcInfo to verify logical consistency. All attribute values fall within defined values. Line topology present.
dataqual.complete: Some contours were interpolated using other sources such as nautical charts and depth soundings (Geodas). This was only done in areas where text on the chart covered a contour.

horizpa.horizpar: Did not conduct positional analysis. Sample plot files were compared to chart and some deviation was observed in some areas. The data will be revisited if time permits.

citeinfo.origin: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), National Ocean Service.
citeinfo.title: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration, Nautical Chart 11013

srcinfo.srccontr: The source chart (11013) provided depth contours measured in fathoms

procstep.procdesc: Contours digitized in ArcInfo off NOAA Nautical Chart #11013 at a 1:1,200,000 scale

cntperp.cntorg: FWC-FWRI (Florida Fish and Wildlife Conservation Commission-Fish and Wildlife Research Institute)

cntaddr.address: Fish and Wildlife Research Institute 100 Eighth Avenue Southeast

enttyp.enttypd: Depth contours, in fathoms, for waters off South Florida, Bahamas & Cuba. Shoreline for Bahamas present.

attr.attrdef: Depth of contour in fathoms. 0 = shoreline 999 = chart border 3 = 3 fathoms or 18 feet 10 = 10 fathoms or 60 feet 20 = 20 fathoms or 120 feet 50 = 50 fathoms or 300 feet 100 = 100 fathoms or 600 feet 1000 = 1000 fathoms or 6000 feet

Depth of contour in feet. 0 = shoreline 999 = chart border 18 = 18 feet or 3 fathoms 60 = 60 feet or 10 fathoms 120 = 120 feet or 20 fathoms 300 = 300 feet or 50 fathoms 600 = 600 feet or 100 fathoms 6000 = 6000 feet or 1000 fathoms
attr.attrdefs: 1 fathom = 6 feet. National Institute of Standards and Technology http://ts.nist.gov/ts/htdocs/230/appxc/$temp.htm

overview.eaover: Each contour contains the attributes FATHOM and FEET, which represent the shallowest contour depth in the respective units. A value of 999 indicates the line is a chart border.
overview.eadetcit: Each contour contains the attributes FATHOM and FEET, which represent the shallowest contour depth in the respective units. A value of 999 indicates the line is a chart border.

distinfo.distliab: This data set is in the public domain, and the recipient may not assert any proprietary rights thereto nor represent it to anyone as other than a FWC-FWRI produced data set or the appropriate originator; it is provided "as-is" without warranty of any kind, including, but not limited to, the implied warranties of merchantability and fitness for a particular purpose. The user assumes all responsibility for the accuracy and suitability of this data set for a specific application. In no event will the staff of the Fish and Wildlife Research Institute be liable for any damages, including lost profits, lost savings, or other incidental or consequential damages arising from the use of or the inability to use this data set.

stdorder.fees: None. However, persons or organizations requesting information must provide transfer media if FTP is not available and must pay express shipping costs if express shipping is required.
stdorder.ordering: Contact GIS Librarian by e-mail, telephone, or letter explaining which products are needed and providing a brief description of how the products will be used. Also, provide name and address of the person or organization requesting the products.
stdorder.turnarnd: Usually within 10 business days, although, complex requests may take longer

distinfo.custom: These data have caveats. Contact GIS Librarian for details. If these data are maintained by an agency other than FWC-FWRI, then the source agency should be contacted directly for requests.
distinfo.techpreq: Software capable of reading Arc/Info coverages or ArcView shapefiles.
